results.title: Lawrence of Arabia didn't come down this far
results.creator_credit: Julian Cooper and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A carpenter from England in search of his personal dream worked on a building site in Kuwait for a year. Tells the story of his adventure, and also looks in detail at Kuwait and its secret, male dominated society. Photography by Ken Lowe and edited by Graham Shipham. Narrated by Jonathan Raban.

results.title: Lawrence of Arabia [Director's cut]
results.creator_credit: Sam Spiegel, Columbia, Horizon (GB) and David Lean
results.brief_description: A sweeping, breathtaking epic covering the life of T. E. Lawrence. Throughout his two years in Arabia during the First World War, he succeeded in uniting the Arab tribes against the Turks and became a legend in his own time, the great Lawrence of Arabia. Starring Peter O’Toole, Omar Sharif, Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn, Jack Hawkins, Claude Rains, Jose Ferrer and Anthony Quayle, Lean’s breathtaking film won seven Oscars in 1962, despite suffering some major cuts, with loss of footage for thirty years. Those dramatic scenes have been restored in this Director’s Cut.

Those dramatic scenes have been restored in this Director’s Cut.

results.title: Lawn tennis and how to play it: the service
results.brief_description: First of a series of six instructional films supervised by Captain H.R. Brand, this film shjows a number of important points about the service which every aspiring tennis champion must know. Demonstrations are given by Mary Heeley and Horace Skeet, All England Tennis Club Professional and Coach.

results.title: Lawn tennis and how to play it. No. 4. The Volley and smash
results.brief_description: Demonstrations by Horace Skeet, Mary Heeley, Miki and other celebrated players. Emphasises the importance of correct positioning of the feet for backhand and forehand volleys, and points out that it is better to place a volley rather than give it power. The smash is seen to be executed in the same way as a serve.

results.title: Lawn dogs
results.creator_credit: Duncan Kenworthy, Rank Film Productions and John Duigan
results.brief_description: Camelot Gardens is a “gated community” for the wealthy with luxurious yet sterile homes, and a security force which ensures that riff-raff will be kept off the grounds after dark. The Stockard family are the new kids on the block, obsessed with acceptance and political advancement within the community. Their ten year old daughter, Devon (Mischa Barton), is not interested in befriending children her own age. One day she wanders into the nearby woods and discovers Trent, a 22 year old who scrapes together a living by mowing the lawns of the wealthy inhabitants of Camelot Gardens. Both Trent and Devon have physical and emotional scars to deal with, and they soon become friends. However, things come to head when the community discovers that Devon’s best friend is a grown man. Cast also includes: Sam Rockwell, Chris McDonald and Kathleen Quinlan.

results.title: Lawn bowls
results.creator_credit: Queensland.Dept. of Education. Production Services Branch and Don Smith
results.brief_description: Designed to introduce and teach the skills of lawn bowls. Introduces the game, how and where it is played, the equipment and clothing used and provides a demostration of play and scoring. The second half presents a comprehensive overview of the basic techniques required.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Queensland.Dept. of Education. Production Services Branch and Don Smith

results.title: Law: a system of order
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Telemated Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Conflict is inevitable in life and each individual must give up some of their freedom in order to live peaceably in proximity with others. This film looks at some of the origins of law in earlier cultures, their mode of enforcement, and examines also a range of human actions subject to social censure - from abuses of custom to serious criminal offences.
